w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic greetings and introductions by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: I like, I don’t like, do you like, He likes, she likes
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for the likes and dislikes
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: he, she, I, like, don’t like
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.

each time you see and hear it
Read the poem to the student. Emphasize the word,
as you say it and encourage the child to do the same (as there are many “likes” in the poem).
and give a thumbs-up. Encourage the student to do the same.
The teacher should give a thumbs-up and say, “I like.” Then she should give a thumbs-down and say, “I don’t like” Encourage child to repeat after you with the phrases and actions.
with a thumbs-up and a smile
with a thumbs-down and a frown

phrases again by saying the phrase, doing the thumbs-up or thumbs-down action and adding facial expressions that match the yellow faces. Encourage child to copy saying the phrase, doing the action and doing the facial expression.
Circle each food as the teacher asks
The teacher should introduce the name of each food. Have the student repeat and pronounce the name of each food correctly
Have the students circle the foods one at a time in random order.
Answer these questions, “Do you like ice cream?” in a complete sentence:

The teacher should model asking and answering a question using a puppet. The teacher should ask the puppet, “Do you like ice cream?” The puppet should answer, “Yes, I like ice cream,” and attempt to have the puppet give a thumbs-up. Or the teacher can gi
Ask the student, “Do you like ice cream?” Prompt the student to answer in a complete sentence: “
Answer these questions, “Do you like jalapeños?” in a complete sentence:

The teacher should model asking and answering a question using a puppet. The teacher should ask the puppet, “Do you like jalapeños?” The puppet should answer, “No, I don’t like jalapeños,” and attempt to have the puppet give a thumbs-down. Or the teacher
can give a thumbs-down as well.
Ask the student, “Do you like jalapeños?” Prompt the student to answer in a complete sentence.
Circle what you like to eat
Say a complete phrase about what you like to eat after being asked: Example:

The teacher will model one food she likes. The teacher should point to herself (like the boy in the picture) give a thumbs-up and circle the pizza. Then the teacher should say, “I like pizza,” with all those actions. Clear the screen.
, “Do you like __ice cream_____?” using a thumbs-up and raised hands like you use when asking a question. Prompt and guide the student to circle the foods they like to eat.
Prompt and guide the student to say what they like in a complete sentence:
Circle what you DON’T like to eat
Say a complete phrase about what you DON’T like to eat after being asked:

The teacher will model one food she doesn’t like. The teacher should point to herself (like the boy in the picture) give a thumbs-down and circle the jalapeño. Then the teacher should say, “I don’t like jalapeños,” with all those actions. Clear the screen
The teacher will ask, “Do you like ___celery____?” using a thumbs-down and raised hands you use when asking a question. Prompt and guide the student to circle the foods they don’t like to eat.

Name the three people in the picture (their pronoun). Repeat two times.

Encourage student to complete the sentence frames independently. Use a thumbs-up to prompt the student to say the word
The student will answer appropriately to questions that begin, “Do you like ______?”

The teacher should ask if the student likes 2-3 things from the pictures above. The teacher should use the sentence frame, “Do you like ________?” Encourage the student to answer with complete sentences: Example:
Say the name of the flavors two times
Say what flavor you like and don’t like
The teacher should say the name of the flavors of the ice cream. Have the student repeat two times.
Do you like strawberry ice cream?”

Yes, I like strawberry ice cream
